Definition.Document:
Transition Analysis

Calculate near real-time production-scale column HETP and Asymmetry during column transition periods to monitor for column integrity and consistent operations using the moment analysis technique.

Contextualize

Begin with the conductivity and flow rate signals. Clean and smooth signal as needed. 

  • Cleaned Signals

Identify transition periods with conductivity, flow, or DCS phase type signal(s).

  • Transition Periods 

Calculate

HETP

Quantify the column efficiency by calculating the HETP using a moment analysis.

  • HETP

Asymmetry 

Quantify the column integrity and pack quality by calculating peak asymmetry using volume changes.

  • Asymmetry

Monitor

Set thresholds and monitor the HETP and Asymmetry in real time.

  • Deviations
Definition.DocumentBackup\u02c9-jPWuY9WzL6sLEmpYVGB:
Transition Analysis

Calculate production-scale column HETP and Asymmetry during column transition periods to monitor for column integrity and consistent operations using the moment analysis technique.

  • Increase data integrity and optimize operator's time: Reduced operator input by 16hrs/batch
  • HETP and Asymmetry results real-time: Eliminate delayed results and go/no go decision
  • Monitor and Predict future column re-slurry and repack: condition based action preventing major deviations ($100,000+/occurrence)

Challenge

TA is essential to assessing column efficiency and integrity. Typical methods for performing the analysis require complex data post-processing well after the process has completed. 

Solution

Leverage Seeq to connect, clean, and contextualize data. Perform calculations in real-time. Eliminate the often delayed, tedious, and error-prone manual process. Identify drift and early signs of column degradation. 

Contextualization

Populate relevant signals and conditions. This can include conductivity, flow, and event data. Add transition period context.

  • Data and Transitions

Calculate

Calculate the moments, variance, and use to get the HETP. Determine the volume change ratio over the left and right sides of  the curves to calculatio asymmetry. 

  • HETP and Asymmetry

Monitor

Set thresholds and monitor the HETP and Asymmetry in real time.

  • Deviations --> Summary Table

Predict and Notify

Create a time based model of HETP to predict when the efficiency of the column is anticipated to drop below the control limits. Notify of drift.

  • HETP Prediction

Transition Analysis

Calculate near real-time production-scale column HETP and Asymmetry during column transition periods to monitor for column integrity and consistent operations using the moment analysis technique.

  • Monitor and Predict future column re-slurry and repack: condition based action preventing major deviations ($100,000+/occurrence)

Challenge

TA is essential to assessing column efficiency and integrity. Typical methods for performing the analysis require complex data post-processing well after the process has completed. 

Solution

Leverage Seeq to connect, clean, and contextualize data. Perform calculations in real-time. Eliminate the often delayed, tedious, and error-prone manual process. Identify drift and early signs of column degradation. 

Contextualize

Begin with the conductivity and flow rate signals. Clean and smooth signal as needed. 

  • Raw Signals
  • Cleaned** 

Identify transition periods with conductivity, flow, or DCS phase type signal(s). Combine the periods where the derivative is positive and flow is low to identify the transitions.

  • Transition Periods 

Calculate

HETP

Quantify the column efficiency by calculating the HETP using a moment analysis.

Done by applying eq.1-5 which integrates the feed flow over the transition periods to get the volume and then the calculating dC/dV to get the  moments and variance.

  • HETP

Asymmetry 

Quantify the column integrity and pack quality by calculating peak asymmetry by finding the volume changes over the left and right sides of the dC/dV curve at 10% of max.

  • Volume Change

Using the change on volume over the left and right sides, calculate the asymmetry. 

  • Asymmetry

Monitor

Set thresholds and monitor the HETP and Asymmetry in real time.

  • Deviations
  • Summary Table

Definition.Froala Backup:
Transition Analysis

The Outcome

Calculate production-scale column HETP and Asymmetry during column transition periods to monitor for column integrity and consistent operations using the moment analysis technique.

  • Reduce operator input -> increase data integrity and optimize operator's work
  • Real-time insights -> prevent subsequent batch delay and deviations
  • Predict future column repack -> data driven column/resin management 

The Challenge

TA is essential to assessing column the conditions and integrity of a column. Typical methods for performing the analysis require complex data post-processing that are no real time, often well after the process, and siloed due to the complex and manual nature of the calculations. 

The Solution

Leverage Seeq to bring in data, clean and contextualize the data, and perform the calculations in real-time. Eliminate the delayed, tedious, manual, and error prone process. Rapidly identify drift and early signs of column degradation. 

Jan 30, 2023 2:40 PM - Jan 30, 2023 7:40 PM

Data and Contextualization

Begin with the conductivity and flow rate signals. Clean and smooth signal as needed. 

  • Raw Signals
  • Cleaned Signals

Identify transition periods with conductivity, flow, or DCS phase type signal(s). Combine positive derivative and low flow periods to identify the transition periods.

  • Transition Periods

HETP 

Calculate the moments (eq. 1-3) by first integrating the feed flow over the transition periods to get the volume and then the calculating dC/dV.

  • Moments

Using the moments and volume, the variance is calculated (eq. 4), which is used to calculate the HETP (eq. 5).

  • HETP - Chain

Asymmetry 

Determine 10% of the max of the dC/dV during the transition. Identify the left and right sides of the transition peak. Aggregate the left and right side change in volume respectively.

  • dV Overlay

Using the change on volume over the left and right sides, calculate the asymmetry.

  • Asymmetry

Monitor

Set thresholds and monitor the HETP and Asymmetry in real time.

  • Trend - Deviation
  • Historical Table

Predict

Create a time based model of HETP to predict when the efficiency of the column is anticipated to drop below the control limits.

  • HETP Model
  • Condition Based Actions
